Display module¶

Animate function¶

profitroll.display.animate.make_video(pathCDF, save_path, variable, cmap='magma')¶

Loads the data stored in a NetCDF file, builds a video of the asked variable and saves it. It returns an HTML animation that can be displayed in a Jupyter notebook.

Parameters

  • pathCDF (string) – path of the NetCDF file where to read the data

  • save_path (string) – path where to save the video

  • variable (string) – physical quantity to plot on video, must belong to the NetCDF file

Returns

an HTML animation containing the video asked

Return type

IPython.core.display.HTML

profitroll.display.animate.var2str(var_name)¶

Convert names used for computation into better suitables names for plots (specific to the tropopause problem and the examples already implemented)

Parameters

var_name (str) – name of the variable during computation

Returns

the name of the variable for the plots

Return type

str

Interacting_plot¶

profitroll.display.interacting_plot.interactive_plot(pathCDF)¶

Interactive plot of all the variables of a NetCDF file.

Parameters

pathCDF (str) – Path to the NetCDF file

Returns

the interactive object for interactive plots

Return type

ipywidgets.widgets.interactive object

profitroll.display.interacting_plot.plot_data(pathCDF, variable, time, cmap='magma')¶

Plot a variable from a NetCDF file using matlplotlib.

Parameters

  • pathCDF (str) – path of the NetDCF file

  • variable (str) – name of the variable to plot

  • time (int) – rank of the time step to plot

  • cmap (str, optional) – colormap to use, defaults to ‘magma’
